text: Glenn Henry "Mr. Goalie" Hall (born October 3, 1931, in Humboldt, Saskatchewan, Canada) is a Canadian retired professional ice hockey goaltender. During his National Hockey League career with the Detroit Red Wings, Chicago Black Hawks, and St. Louis Blues, Hall rarely missed a game, winning the Vezina Trophy three times, and the Calder Memorial Trophy. According to hockey lore, Hall threw up before every game and drank a glass of orange juice. == References == ==Other websites== * *Glenn Hall biography * Category:1931 births Category:Living people Category:Calder Trophy winners Category:Canadian ice hockey goaltenders Category:Chicago Blackhawks players Category:Conn Smythe Trophy winners Category:Detroit Red Wings players Category:Hockey Hall of Fame inductees Category:Ice hockey people from Saskatchewan Category:Indianapolis Capitals players Category:St. Louis Blues players Category:Stanley Cup champions Category:Vezina Trophy winners Category:Ontario Hockey League players
title: Glenn Hall
